title: Baseball Writers' awards a success
subtitle: Baseball Writers' awards a success
body: NEW YORK -- Right about the time Bob DuPuy, the president and CEO of all of Major League Baseball, handed him his American League Rookie of the Year Award ... Huston Street figured that would've been a good point to wake up with his head on his pillow.  "I'm truly privileged, to be up here a year out of college," said Street, the Oakland closer, who then looked to his left and thought he was still dreaming.  "I'm sitting two seats away from Mariano Rivera. And there's Bob Gibson, Cal Ripken. It's been an unbelievable night for me." Tom Singer is a reporter for MLB.com. This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs.
author: Tom Singer
